text: I'll never forget playing this game on the GBA. The graphics and audio quality were a big step above the competition, the whole package was mighty impressive really. I really wish Nintendo was more ambitious with this beloved series as I feel like they're basing the series' potential on the disappointing sales of Dark Dawn, which felt like the safest sequel ever. Golden Sun for the Switch... do it!
author: SupraDarky

text:
SupraDarky both Golden Suns have a really good soundtrack and this was one of the best tracks.

They should put the first two games on the Switch as a sort of collection that has the password feature removed so you can transfer data easier
author: MrRaui

text: I loved the first two Golden Sun games. Dark Dawn felt weak and was very disappointing. I'd love more Golden Sun, but... y'know... good.
author: Serin9X

text: Right along with Suikoden 2 I really appreciate this series. There are few RPG's that have my devoted time and patience. I wish this series a warm welcome for any new or seasoned gamer.
author: TBD Art

text: Golden Sun and Lost Age are easily my favourite GBA games of all time... Such masterpieces
author: Recht_voor_zijn_raap

text:
I felt Dark Dawn's problem is they clearly set up one plot only to decide: "Nah, we're going to do this plot instead."

(seriously would have loved to see grown-up Jenna, though.)
author: EvilMariobot

text:
@EvilMariobot 
A fetch quest turned story. Throw in the multiple points of no return. And puzzles that were easier and held your hand throughout...And you get a pretty meh third game!
author: garfreeek

text: I took a chance on GoldenSun after reading many reviews. And I’m glad I did because the two GBA releases are flawless!
author: 7th AngelAD

text: Yeah, we must defeat Alex.
author: Trapster2

text: I would consider buying another Switch if a new Golden Sun were developed for it just to show support. The two GS for GBA are amazing jrpgs!

text: Ah, yes. Probably the best two games for the GBA.

text: Golden sun best RPG game for me!

text: Top 3 of my all time favourite games. This is one hell of a track
author: Giovanni

text: This sound track has such a pleasant effect!!!! I remember pausing the game just to keep listening this music.... It always felt like as if I'm floating in heaven!!! This game could have given Final Fantasy a tough challenge if they released some more games...... At least they should re make the GS 1 and GS 2 with better graphics. This game deserves it.
author: Masud Tazrian

text: The House... of the Golden Sun.

text: I've really got to get to this series one day...

text:
i get that many dont like Golden Sun, for me its a special classic RPG.

Good ol days
I liked Dark Dawn, safe yes, but i personally enjoyed it alot. 
Feels bad though that Camelot is forever stuck making Mario Sports titles. Without RPG elements.

text: I love this game, still remember the enjoyment me and my brother had playing the 2 games on our GBA back in the day <3

text:

This really does need to get another game, on the Switch preferably.

text: 100% with you there, bro.

text: Good times. They'd really have to develop past the old formula if they were to make a fourth game (Dark Dawn fell a bit short), but I'd welcome it if only for the great aesthetic.

text: One of my favorite pieces of video game music ever. Would love to see them bring this series back!
author: Ryan Woolley

text: I remember when I first got my hands on golden sun as a kid at a flea market in Switzerland. The game was so enamouring I loved it. The soundtrack of the first two games was amazing this theme and also the Lemuria theme.
author: Fasine Ngo

text: This (and its part 2.. Its actually one big game) are easily the best games for the GBA, by far the best handheld RPGs, and even some of the best games ever made.. If you never played these: Do yourself a favor and play them.
author: Recht_voor_zijn_raap
